gurmukhi: ਰਥੀ ਨਾਗ ਕੂਟੇ ॥ ਫਿਰੈਂ ਬਾਜ ਛੂਟੇ ॥
translation: Many charioteers were killed and the horses began to roam in the battlefield unclaimed.

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਜੁੱਧ ਭਾਰੀ ॥ ਛੁਟੀ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਤਾਰੀ ॥੮੯॥
translation: This war was so dreadful that even the meditation of Shiva was ruptured.89.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਘੰਟ ਭੇਰੀ ॥ ਡਹੇ ਡਾਮ ਡੇਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Bade Ghant Bderee|| Dahe Daam Deree||
translation: The resounding of the gongs, drums and tabors began.
The trumpets were sounded and the horses neighed.90.

gurmukhi: ਧਹਾ ਧੂਹ ਧੋਪੰ ॥ ਟਕਾ ਟੂਕ ਟੋਪੰ ॥
transliteration: Dhahaa Dhooh Dhopan|| Takaa Took Topan||
translation: Various sounds arose in the battlefield and there were knocking on the helmets.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਚਰਮ ਬਰਮੰ ॥ ਪਲਿਯੋ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਧਰਮੰ ॥੯੧॥
transliteration: Kate Charam Baramannd|| Paliyo Chhattra Dharamannd||91||
translation: The armours on the bodies were chopped and the heroes followed the discipline of Kshatriyas.91.

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਦੁੰਦ ਜੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਭਰਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhayo Dound Juddhan|| Bdaryo Raam Kruddhan||
translation: Ram was highly infuriated on seeing the continuance of the terrible war.
He chopped the arms of Subahu and killed him.92.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਸੈ ਦੈਤ ਭਾਜੇ ॥ ਰਣੰ ਰਾਮ ਗਾਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Trasai Dait Bhaaje|| Ranan Raam Gadje||
translation: On seeing this, the frightened demons ran away and Ram thundered in the battlefield.
Ram lightened the burden of the earth and protected the sages.93.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਸਾਧ ਹਰਖੇ ॥ ਭੲੇ ਜੀਤ ਕਰਖੇ ॥
transliteration: Sabhai Saadh Harkhe|| Bhae Jeet Karkhe||
translation: All the saints were pleased over the victory.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ਦੇਵ ਅਰਚਾ ॥ ਰਰੈ ਬੇਦ ਚਰਚਾ ॥੯੪॥
transliteration: Darai Dev Archaa|| Darai Bed Chachaa||94||
translation: The gods were worshipped and the discussion on Vedas began.94.

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਜੱਗ ਪੂਰੰ ॥ ਗੲੇ ਪਾਪ ਦੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhayo Jagg Pooran|| Gad Paap Dooran||
translation: The Yajna (of Vishwamitra) was complete and all the sins were destroyed.
On seeing this, the gods were pleased and began to shower flowers.95.
